title: Simon Cowell enjoys bike ride with Lauren Silverman and son Eric in LA
text:
He recently debuted a new slimmed down appearance after shedding 20lbs since going on a strict vegan diet.

And Simon Cowell continued to showcase his incredible transformation as he enjoyed a bike ride with partner Lauren Silverman and son Eric along the beach in California on Saturday.

The talent show judge, 59, looked happier than ever as he cycled beside the boardwalk with Lauren's son Adam in a loose-fitting charcoal grey T-shirt and complementing shorts.

Soaking up the sun: Simon Cowell continued to showcase his incredible transformation as he enjoyed a bike ride with partner Lauren Silverman and son Eric along the beach in California on Saturday

The TV star round off his casual attire with a pair of cream sliders while Lauren looked effortlessly chic in a pair of khaki-coloured peddle pushers and loose-fitting grey marl tee.

The make-up artist, who has been dating the music mogul for six years, donned a pair of tan leather sandals and a matching belt as she followed behind her boys.

Looking glamorous as ever, the American beauty neatly blowdried her brunette tresses and accessorised her look with a pair of chic shades.

Meanwhile, five-year-old Eric looked adorable on his navy Real Madrid jersey and beige shorts cycling on his orange bike.

All smiles: The talent show judge, 59, looked happier than ever as he cycled beside the boardwalk with Lauren's son Adam in a loose-fitting charcoal grey T-shirt

The outing looked like the perfect start to Simon's birthday celebrations as he's set to turn 60 on Monday.

In light of his upcoming milestone, the TV judge recently underwent a radical health kick and has cut out dairy, sugar, bread, gluten, and meat from his diet.

He insisted that he won't even let the regime slack on his 60th birthday and vowed: 'No cakes. There will not be a birthday cake.'

The Britain's Got Talent judge recently admitted during an appearance on The Ellen DeGeneres Show that he drastically changed his diet so he could keep up with Eric.

Out and about: The TV star round off his casual attire with a pair of cream sliders while Lauren looked effortlessly chic in a pair of khaki-coloured peddle pushers and loose-fitting grey marl tee

He said: 'I went to see this doctor in London. We did some tests. And then a month later he said, "You have the worst diet I've ever met from any patient."

'So I went, "Okay, out of the smoking, the drinking, and diet, what do I have to drop?" And he said, "The diet." So I said, "I'm in!"

'It was easier than I thought, and part of the reason I did it was because of Eric. I realised if I didn't sort myself out physically, I wouldn't be able to catch up with him.

'Because the minute he gets up to the minute he goes to sleep ... their energy, you forget, at five years old, is phenomenal.'

Adorable: Eric, five, looked adorable on his navy Real Madrid jersey and beige shorts cycling on his orange bike

Simon previously said he'd named his diet the Eric Cowell diet after his son, because the youngster loves to munch on raw vegetables.

He said: 'It's like the Eric diet because he actually, apart from ice cream, he actually likes water. I mean, who likes water? And his raw vegetables. So I'm on like, the Eric Cowell diet.'

Simon recently appeared on Lorraine where his ex-girlfriend Terri Seymour grilled him about life as a dad to Eric and how his life has transformed.

In a touching sentiment, Simon admitted life is 'more simple and fun' since becoming a father, as he said: 'I see my life through his eyes now and it’s much more simple and it’s much more fun.'

Celebrations: The outing looked like the perfect start to Simon's birthday celebrations as he's set to turn 60 on Monday

When asked about what the biggest change has been in fatherhood, he said: 'When you become a dad, something clicks in you. It’s all about them.

'You become very protective and importantly, part of the reason I changed everything in my life'.

On other elements of his life that Eric has changed, Simon discussed his lifestyle overhaul which saw him shed the weight.

Additionally, he has stepped back his working duties too so as to ensure he can give Eric his very best and remain rested for their time together.

He said: 'I was like a vampire, I realised that I was going to sleep between 5 and 7 in the morning and then the trouble with that is, no matter if you get six hours, eight hours, you always wake up tired, that’s the problem...

'So along with the diet, I changed my hours so I go to sleep at 10pm and I now have breakfast at 8.30am. It’s almost like a complete reversal.'
